title: Silent 1:1s
situation: Your weekly 1:1s feel flat. Your report answers questions briefly and rarely brings topics of their own.
question: How do you change the pattern?

choices.label: Keep asking, “So, how’s everything?” and hope they open up eventually.
choices.outcome: The meetings stay vague and surface-level.
choices.insight: Vague questions lead to vague answers. Structure can make it safer to share real topics.

choices.label: Introduce a simple structure: “Let’s spend 10 minutes on your wins, 10 on challenges, and 10 on anything you want from me.”
choices.outcome: They know what to prepare and the time feels more purposeful for both of you.
choices.insight: Clear containers help people bring more of what’s actually on their mind.

choices.label: Tell them they’re not using the 1:1 well and should come more prepared.
choices.outcome: They may feel criticized without knowing what “better” looks like.
choices.insight: It’s easier for people to step into a structure you create than a criticism you broadcast.
